userStories.title: Legacy Workflow Template Source (cold-email-system)
userStories.description: The Leads Campaign workspace uses legacy workflows from cold-email-system/ folder, not the standard base-cold-email/ templates. The API route should detect legacy workspaces and load from cold-email-system/ instead.
acceptanceCriteria: API route GET /api/sandbox/workflow/[campaignId] checks for legacy template source
Legacy workspaces load templates from cold-email-system/ directory
Standard workspaces continue loading from base-cold-email/
Template file mapping works for both directories

userStories.title: Enable Free Node Positioning on Canvas
userStories.description: Enable nodesDraggable on the WorkflowCanvas so users can freely position nodes. Remove the no-op drag handler. Edges should remain connected and visible as smooth-step connections between nodes.
acceptanceCriteria: Nodes are draggable on the canvas
Edges remain connected during and after drag
Smooth-step edge type with visible connection lines between nodes

userStories.title: Fix Campaign vs Sequence Naming in Dropdown
userStories.description: The WorkflowSelector tabs (Email 1, Email 2, Email 3) are sequences within a single campaign, not separate campaigns. Update the header text and ensure the campaign dropdown shows actual campaign names, while the tabs clearly label as sequences/workflows within that campaign.
acceptanceCriteria: Campaign dropdown shows actual campaign names
WorkflowSelector tabs are labeled as sequences/workflows, not campaigns
Header clarifies the relationship between campaign and sequences

userStories.title: Dark Mode and Tooltip Visibility Fixes
userStories.description: Fix dark mode issues: ReactFlow Controls (zoom in/out/reset) invisible against white background, campaign selector box is white in dark mode, replace default browser tooltip with custom themed tooltip.
acceptanceCriteria: ReactFlow Controls buttons visible in dark mode with proper contrast
Campaign selector dropdown matches dark theme
Custom tooltip replaces default Chrome tooltip on campaign selector
All interactive elements have proper dark mode contrast
